CatDescriptText: Michael Kudrav, community house worker, Fifth Avenue, and Ray Jackson, city employee, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 28, 1962, pg. 15 with question: "When do you think the Pirates will move into first place?"  Mr. Kudrav's answer reads: "It all centers on the pitching.  If Earl Francis and Joe Gibbon come through for them, they'll finish all right.  It depends on their arms.  The reason why the Dodgers are doing so well is because they have good pitching, even if they lack something on the hitting side."  Mr. Jackson's answer reads: "No time.  They're going to end up in the second division where they belong.  Los Angeles will take the pennant."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Michael Kudrav wearing striped button down collared shirt with short sleeves, standing in front of hillside and billboard; Portrait of Ray Jackson wearing light colored button down collared shirt and hat with patterned band, standing in front of car and building
